info.name: Five of a Kind Duel
info.attribution:
Layout, design, and library image by LawDawg96. English rules translated from German by ChatGPT and summarized by LawDawg96. Released to the Public Domain under CC0.

Wood grain background by RyanPro available under the Pixabay license from https://pixabay.com/photos/trees-wood-yellow-wood-oak-1915247/
info.description: A tug-of-war twist on a classic dice-rolling game. Be the first to get 5 total disks or 3 adjacent disks on your side.
info.ruleText:
Players sit in seats and press the Restart button. A random player will be selected to begin.

On your turn, you may roll up to three times by pressing the Roll Dice button. Keep any number of dice between rolls, if desired, by moving them to the Keep holder. Or return dice back to the Roll holder to roll them again. After the final roll, if you have achieved one of the combinations shown on the board, you move that categoryâ€™s disk toward your side. The first time a category is achieved, the disk moves from the center to the holder on that player's side of the board with the combination label. After that, it moves back and forth between players (and skipping over the center) whenever that combination is rolled. If you roll a combination and the disk is already on your side, you may move it into your round holder to secure it permanently. The 5 of a Kind category is not subject to the back-and-forth; the first player to get 5 of a Kind moves the disk into the holder on their side and secures it. If you cannot move any disk on your turn (either because you did not roll a valid combination or the disk is already secured by either player), move a joker disk of your color to an area on your side of the room. Jokers can later be used to change dice to any value. You may use multiple jokers in a turn. Put used jokers back in the supply. If you want to change the face of a die because you used a joker, click it to increase its value by one. Combinations include:
  • At least three of a specific number (one through six)
  • Small Straight (four in sequence)
  • Large Straight (five in sequence)
  • Four of a Kind (at least four of the same number)
  • Full House (three of one number and two of another)
  • Five of a Kind (all five dice are the same)
To win, be the first player to secure 5 disks total, or secure 3 disks that are in adjacent spaces.
